description:
|  Chaos Group is a Bulgarian company in the business of software development
and provides innovative rendering solutions for the media, entertainment, and
design industries. Our portfolio includes the following outstanding products:
V-Ray for Autodesk®3ds Max®, V-Ray for Autodesk® Maya®, V-Ray for Rhino, V-Ray
for SketchUp, Phoenix FD - the simulator for fire, smoke and liquids and
Pdplayer – the production oriented image sequence player and viewer for the CG
industry. V-Ray has become the renderer of choice in big production studios
across the world. Feature film productions, multi-million dollar game
productions, huge and small architectural visualizations have trusted their
visuals to V-Ray.  
Chaos Group was founded in 1997 in Bulgaria and has grown from a team of two
to a team of more than 200 people located in our offices in Europe, USA, Japan
and Korea. We continue to grow our team and we are looking for more new
colleagues:  
  
** MS Dynamics CRM Integrator and Administrator**  
  
** Short Job Description:**  
Chaos Group reaches its global market through a resellers’ network and direct
online operations. Further, Chaos Group focuses on complex integration
projects with top partners in its industry. Through its sales channels Chaos
Group serves hundreds of thousands end users.  
This person is going to participate in the implementation and consequent
administration of the Microsoft Dynamics CRM. Works in collaboration with
sales, finance and data management teams to gather data across Chaos Group
internal systems and to build reports.  
  
** Responsibilities:**  
To understand the marketing, sales and all CRM related processes and needs of
the Chaos Group and to make sure he/she builds functionalities in such a way
so the requirements are addressed and solved. To facilitate managers by
providing the necessary reporting or by building processes in the CRM or
Marketing Automation systems that will help them.  
  
**Requirements:**  
  
** Technical skills and qualifications:**   
• Experience with MS Dynamics CRM implementation and integration.  
• Experience in data management.  
• Fluent English language.  
• University education in Engineering specialty is a plus.  
• Certificate for a Microsoft Dynamics CRM is a plus  
• Implementation and administration of BI tools is a plus.  
  
** Personal skills and characteristics:**   
• Strong communication and problem-solving skills  
• Enjoy interacting with people on various levels in the organization  
• Ability to rapidly learn new areas  
• Strong analysis skills  
• Posses the ability to make critical business recommendations and think
strategically  
  
**We can offer You:**  
• Flexible working hours;  
• Competitive remuneration package and benefits, based on personal
achievements;  
• Friendly working environment in a team of highly motivated people;  
• An opportunity to take part in the development of high level software that
defines the future of the digital image rendering for the purposes of movie
and game entertainment industry.  
  
Apart from the basic qualifications, we welcome people who are flexible in
thought, value teamwork and are obsessed with quality.  
If Your profile matches our requirements and You are interested in working at
Chaos Group just send us Your resume.  
  
Only short-listed candidates will be contacted via e-mail or phone!  
Confidentiality of all applications is assured!

description:
|  Visteon is a global technology company that designs, engineers and
manufactures innovative cockpit electronics products and connected car
solutions for most of the world’s major vehicle manufacturers. Visteon is a
leading provider of driver information and controls, audio and infotainment,
and domain controllers; its brands include LightScape®, OpenAir® and
SmartCore™. With Visteon has more than 12,000 employees at 50 facilities in 21
countries.  
  
Nowadays, Safety engineering is a very important part of automotive
electronics development process. Due to ever increasing demand for new
features in the modern vehicles, the complexity of automotive electronics
products is continuously increasing as well. This situation motivated
automotive industry to define a new safety standard (ISO26262) which was
released in middle of November of 2011. It incorporates state-of-art technical
solutions and best process practices, aimed at current and future electronics
development. The knowledge on how to foresee and prevent future failures
within the development cycle itself is becoming the key factor for success of
electronics product launches. The implementation of this new vision is lead by
a Safety engineer. Be part of it with your skills and ideas now – at Visteon!
For our Design Center in Sofia we are now looking for a communicative and
organized person to join our team at the position of:  
  
Functional Safety Engineer  
  
Your Responsibilities:  
As part of our team you will be responsible for:  
• Analyzing customer’s requirements and understand customer specific
expectations  
• Construction and documentation of functional safety concept for system and
software  
• Elicition of system safety requirements and maintain requirements
traceability  
• Analyzing requirements and resolving stakeholder conflicts  
• Facilitate the product and software architecture definition  
• Argumentation for maturity level of the system and software design  
• Coach team members to increase safety knowledge  
• Build a system test concept  
  
Your Qualifications  
Positive and self driven achiever with:  
• University degree in the area of Computer Systems, Electronics, Automation
or Information Technologies  
• Knowledge in general electronics  
• Professional experience in design embedded systems and specification
construction  
• Strong analytical and problem solving skills  
• Knowledge in electronics safety standard (ISO26262, IEC61508…) is a plus  
• Knowledge in formal/semi formal software design (Simulink , UML) is a plus  
• Experience in programming language C and software design is a plus  
• Open for travelling abroad and working in multicultural team  
  
Your benefits  
* Advancement opportunities to be part of a global team of experts;  
* Professional development based on up-to-date training opportunities and expertise;  
* Competitive remuneration package with pool of benefits and incentives schemes at place;  
* Open and friendly working atmosphere;  
* Be rewarded with a supportive team and socially responsible corporate environment;   
* Social activities.  
  
Only short-listed applicants will be contacted.

Identify root cause of issues and make appropriate recommendation to avoid

Advanced knowledge of Cisco or HP routers and switches technologies.  
Has sufficient depth and breadth of technical knowledge to design and scope
multiple deliverables across a number of technologies.  
Excellent coordination and communication skills.  
Fluent in English.

professionals and work for an reputable international company? We, at

transform operational efficiency, and deliver new products to market. Amongst

enquiring minds in the industry, and we form close, collaborative

deliver intuitive software that exceeds their expectations.  
Our experience stretches from Cloud, Security and UX Design to Big Analytics
and the Internet of Things, we have offices across the globe and development
centers across Eastern Europe.  
  
We are on the hunt for a talented and self-motivated Senior C++ Software
Engineer to join our team at the newly opened office in Sofia.

graphics processing. Project is in active development to remain leader in its
product niche.

• Deep experience with C++

• Working knowledge with WPF;  
• Working knowledge of Cocoa

problems

media associated with drawing, painting, and printmaking.

• Master degree in Computer Science or similar

title: Network Deal Delivery Assurance Engineer

description:
|

**COMPANY OVERVIEW:**

Hostway Corporation is a leader in Cloud, Managed, and Hybrid Hosting. Hostway
delivers reliable, secure, and scalable Infrastructure-as-a-service (IaaS)
solutions to over 500,000 customers worldwide. Hostway has emerged as one of
the largest cloud hosting and Infrastructure-as-a-Service providers in the
world due to the company’s expertise in developing secure, multi-tenant
hosting environments and is committed to providing SMB's and large enterprises
with cost effective business solutions. Hostway’s core products include
Managed Hosting, Cloud Hosting, Web Hosting and Email and Applications.

**POSITION PURPOSE: **

Hostway Corporation is seeking individuals who are eager, energetic and highly
technical for a Software Developer Engineer position with our Engineering
Services Group, located in Sofia. The applicants will be expected to work in a
team oriented environment tackling tasks at various stages in the development
process ranging from requirements gathering to implementation and testing.
Emphasis is placed on the candidate's contribution to the group and their
advancement in understanding and helping extend and maintain Hostway's
technical infrastructure.

** ****ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**

  * Design, implement and test RESTful APIs communication with different backend systems.
  * Design, implement and test customer facing front-end web applications.
  * Work on test automation for various managed services and other company-specific product development projects.
  * Deliver quality code based on unit and automated acceptance tests.
  * Document and maintain the different systems; investigate and resolve existing problems.
  * Work collaboratively with other engineers and utilize agile development practices.

**DESIRED MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:**

  * BS or higher in Computer Science or equivalent field.
  * Excellent written and verbal communications expected as well as commitment to quality and customer satisfaction.
  * At least two years of programming experience in several programming languages such as: Python and PHP.
  * Extensive experience and knowledge of Object Oriented Programming/Development concepts and practices.
  * Experienced and comfortable with reviewing code written in a number of programming languages.
  * General understanding of networks and network programming techniques.
  * Familiarity with web-based applications and the benefits/limitations of HTML interfaces, including CGI and persistent server application frameworks, RESTful services.
  * Strong analytic mindset, the ability to decompose complex problems into simpler components, and the ability to organize and track complicated project plans.
  * Working knowledge of both UNIX and Windows in a software development setting. Prefer strength in UNIX (all flavors) environment.
  * Experience using version/change control systems (Git, Perforce).
  * Fluent written and spoken English.

**PREFERRED SKILLS:**

  * Experience with Java and JavaScript is a significant plus.
  * Previous experience working with iterative development methodologies, such as Extreme Programming, Scrum or Feature Driven Design.
  * Familiarity with relational database concepts and RDBMS systems such as MySQL, DB2 and SQL Server.
  * Ability to work collaboratively with peers in remote offices.
  * Experience mentoring junior development staff and promoting best practices within the organization.

**WHAT WE OFFER:**

  * An attractive remuneration package!
  * 25 days of annual paid leave! 
  * Work with an enthusiastic team of professionals!
  * Opportunity to work in an international and culturally diverse environment!
  * Opportunity for career development in an IT oriented international company!

**If you’re interested in applying for this position please send us a short cover letter and your CV in English. Hostway thanks all candidates for their interest; however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.**

standards. Ensure designs are built to a high level of quality, usability and
stability

technologies

and project risks  
  
  
Requirements:

• People management skills – ability to manage and potential development of
software developers and QAs  
• Lead development process for long-term software projects

components: C#, MVC, WCF, EF and web technologies such as HTML, CSS,
JavaScript, jQuery, XML, Node.js, Bootstrap  
• Experience in domain driven design and different design patterns

Any of the following will be an advantage:

title: Java Developer

description:
|  Documaster is a tech startup established in 2014 after a pilot project for
Norway’s third largest municipality. In the last two and a half years, our
team grew from three to fifteen people, we got a whole bunch of new investors
on board, and have been enjoying significant attention in our circles and by
media lately.  
  
We are a product company and work in the area of enterprise information
archiving, records management, and electronic government. Our software is
designed to help both public and private sector organizations. After reaching
fifty clients recently, we now aim to double that number by the end of the
year.  
  
The Documaster product development team is mostly concentrated in Sofia,
Bulgaria, and we are currently expanding it with five more people.  
  
**As a system administrator** in our company, you will be responsible for the smooth operation of all Linux servers that run our products as well as the servers that run software supporting our daily work, such as JIRA, Bitbucket, Bamboo, Confluence, and Nexus. Your main challenge will be to help us scale up and support a hundred Documaster installations by the end of 2016, with the clear vision of being able to support three hundred installations a year later.  
  
You will work closely with our hosting partners in Norway to understand the
physical infrastructure that powers our cloud, and suggest improvements. You
will also get into the specifics of our on-premise installations, some of
which are in secure zones that are heavily firewalled.  
  
Working with our developers will be an essential part of your job which will
help you gain insight into the requirements, installation steps, and runtime
specifics of our software. Together with the developers, you will be looking
for ways to streamline the processes of installing the system, upgrading it
with little or no downtime, and backing up all mission critical data. You will
be responsible for documenting these processes, executing them, and writing
Bash or other scripts to automate them when possible.  
  
Another important aspect of your work will be to ensure the security and
integrity of all our servers, taking as many preventive measures as required.
You will also be monitoring the servers and trying to always be the first
person to know if a server is running out of disk space or memory, something
fishy is happening and needs to be investigated, or a security patch needs to
be installed and the server rebooted.  
  
Granting and revoking access rights to servers and software, and monitoring
who does what and when, will also be a part of your daily routine.  
  
Occasionally you will have to save the day with a mind-boggling one-liner
because even developers need heroes.  
  
**We love** seeing motivated and satisfied people in the office every day. If you want to work in a team that constantly challenges you, and the job described here genuinely sparks your interest, you should get in touch with us right away. We will surely offer you a competitive salary if you are the right match for our team. On top of that, we have a bonus system and offer additional health insurance. There are more goodies but we would like to keep them as pleasant surprises.  
  
**Send us your CV** in English and tell us in five sentences why you find this job interesting, and how you will help us be a stronger team.

description:
|  Documaster is a tech startup established in 2014 after a pilot project for
Norway’s third largest municipality. In the last two and a half years, our
team grew from three to fifteen people, we got a whole bunch of new investors
on board, and have been enjoying significant attention in our circles and by
media lately.  
  
We are a product company and work in the area of enterprise information
archiving, records management, and electronic government. Our software is
designed to help both public and private sector organizations. After reaching
fifty clients recently, we now aim to double that number by the end of the
year.  
  
The Documaster product development team is mostly concentrated in Sofia,
Bulgaria, and we are currently expanding it with five more people.  

**As a Documaster QA engineer**, you will be responsible for making sure that the software we craft is always above and beyond the expectations of our customers and end users in terms of quality. You will learn a lot about the intricacies of electronic records management in Scandinavia from our specialist in the area and see how challenging it is to ensure the robustness of software products that must comply with both national and international standards. As a start, you will be performing functional and non-functional tests manually, which will help you get a grip on all aspects of our software. Your most important long-term goal will be to develop a tests automation framework that will allow us to produce more and better products.

You will work closely with our product owner and together define the
requirements for all new functionality we develop. You will also ensure that
every product increment meets the expectations of the business. To achieve
this, you will constantly interact with our developers, suggest improvements
in the software development process, and help us build a company atmosphere
with an ever-increasing awareness of the importance of software quality.

Writing unit and integration tests is one of the key responsibilities of every
developer in the company and, by saying “no” when necessary, you will be
encouraging the developers to write better tests all the time. You will also
be the person to say “no” to a release if the product needs more polishing. To
get this process to work well, you will develop a clear definition of done
that is known to everybody in the company, keeping in mind that developers
also have a similar concept when it comes to code quality.

You will be testing Windows and Apple applications, and web interfaces, making
sure that they look, feel, and work great on each browser in our supported
browsers list. You will also be verifying that documents are converted
correctly to one of several archive formats and that exported data complies
with the standards our software supports. From time to time, you will be
looking directly into a PostgreSQL or MongoDB database to validate the
correctness of the data created by the system. You will face other similar
situations and challenges that will help you develop your technical skills
further and grow professionally.

**We love** seeing motivated and satisfied people in the office every day. If you want to work in a team that constantly challenges you, and the job described here genuinely sparks your interest, you should get in touch with us right away. We will surely offer you a competitive salary if you are the right match for our team. On top of that, we have a bonus system and offer additional health insurance. There are more goodies but we would like to keep them as pleasant surprises.  
  
**Send us your CV** in English and tell us in five sentences why you find this job interesting, and how you will help us be a stronger team.

  * Work with your team providing coaching, mentoring and recognizing top performance of your team to management, allowing them to progress where possible towards their career goals and aspirations

  * Manage and take ownership of escalated customer situations following defined management processes

  * Recommending innovative ways to improve productivity and reduce costs

  * Analyze data & perform a thorough Root Cause Analysis

  * Take new actions within & across teams, to improve quality and share best practices

  * Collaborate across multiple teams for process improvements and standardization

  * Act as a catalyst to drive adherence to all aspects support delivery processes

  * Administer IBM Human Resource processes in an effective and quality manner

  * Other duties as assigned, including support center level responsibilities

**Requirements:  
**  
**Essential:**

  * Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Outlook) advance user skills

  * Excellent English verbal and written skills and the ability to communicate with customers and staff at all levels
  * Decision making under difficult circumstances.
  * Flexibility and ability to and deliver in demanding and changing circumstances.

**Personal Qualities:**

  * Problem solving with a high degree of analytical ability towards the business which assists in the process of identifying additional business opportunities and proposing and implementing process improvements.
  * Positive approach to change and ability to promote new ideas/innovation.

  
**Required:**

  * English: Fluent (B2-C2)

**Preferred:**

  * Knowledge and experience with Cisco Products
  * Basic understanding of computer networking

**Required Technical and Professional Expertise:**

  * Active Cisco CCIE certification in any technology area
  * Minimum 36 months of experience in a technical support center
  * Second level or higher delivery experience
  * Advanced understanding of computer networking - TCP/IP, routing, switching, firewalls

  
  
**Additional information **  
This is an excellent opportunity to lead in a fast growing team in the IBM’s

description:
|

**We are looking for a QA Lead for our EndPoints team. This team is responsible for desktop software running on Windows, MacOS and Linux; for a set of Mobile applications for iOS and Android and for Outlook Add-ins, enriching the end-user experience with our products.**

**This is a high-performing team of 10-12 engineers delivering using Scrum.**

**As a QA Lead, you will be responsible for the test plan and test strategy for each of these products releases. You will own the QA process and workflow, and work in an amazingly collaborative team to make sure we are shipping the best quality software possible.**

**Test automation is in our DNA and we are able to execute tests on multiple devices, running different OSes. As any end-user software, parts of it are tested manually.  
  
**

**Responsibilities**

  * **Implement and ensure quality assurance standards**
  * **Create, maintain and use multiple test plans that are specific per application based on their feature set**
  * **Work collaboratively with engineers to test, discover, resolve any bugs and help prioritize workload**
  * **Report, assign, regress and close bugs using our bug tracking software JIRA.**
  * **Use Xcode, Android Studio and physical iOS and Android devices to conduct testing for mobile Apps.**
  * **Able to perform ad hoc and critical path testing**
  * **Communicate and manage the tracking of any bugs or errors**
  * **Initiate and lead projects that are focused on improving efficiencies across the team.**
  * **Ensure the overall quality of the apps we are shipping is top notch!**
  * **Provide technical mentoring of our less-experienced staff and contributors in the performance of their duties**

**Qualifications**

**Minimum qualifications:**

  * **BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.**
  * **3 years of relevant QA experience**
  * **Outstanding attention to detail and ability to deliver timely and accurate product in a fast-paced and dynamic environment**
  * **Experience with development methodologies (e.g. Agile, SCRUM, etc.)**

  
** Preferred qualifications:**

  * **5 years of relevant QA experience**

  * **Aptitude and desire to own all aspects of Quality for the multitude of applications we ship**

  * **Curious and always exploring**
  * **SCRUM/Agile delivery skills**

  * **Understanding technical architecture to determine project impacts.**
  * **Experience with Jira and/or other bug tracking and QA software a plus**

**  
Why Axway?**

**This job is a great opportunity to deliver high quality products to end-users and receive fast feedback and recognition of your work. You will be exposed to a wide set of technologies and learn new things.**

**We value friendly and open people. We enjoy team and company fun events.**

**We value your work-life balance and provide flexible working hours when needed.**

**We pay premium for top talent.**

|

Paragon Internet Group Bulgaria is looking to hire an experienced PHP
developer to work on internal projects and systems. We run a combination of
home-made and third party systems, servicing just under 200 staff (and
growing) across multiple continents.

You will be streamlining code already in production, working with the wider
development team we have here, putting our existing systems into version
control, setting up tests and bug tracking, and developing new systems and
modules. You should have **at least three years** experience as a PHP
developer, have advanced knowledge of MySQL and experience with at least one
PHP framework (Laravel, Symfony, etc).

We are a quickly growing company with lots of ideas. Technically led and with
a full compliment of technical fun staff, we are really scaling up and looking
to develop systems that take us to the next level. Some of the things you will
be working on

  1. A provisioning and reseller system for one of our newly acquired brands, Mr Site, so that we can sell the product through some of our other brands (Tsohost and Vidahost for example)
  2. Working with our SSL team to optimise the SSL certificate installation and purchase process
  3. Interfacing our new live chat system with our in house ticketing systems
  4. Working with financial teams to produce automated end of month reports
  5. WHM/WHMCS/cPanel API-Dev experience will be considered as a strong advantage

We have an office in Capital Fort on the 15th floor (the whole floor) - right
by the metro and in Sofia's only skyscraper. We're a fun young office.
Excellent written and spoken English is required.

We offer:

  * Premium office location.
  * Competitive salaries.
  * Career progression.
  * Fun nights.
  * Gym membership.
  * Amazing office atmosphere.
  * Taxi vouchers.

We would like you to provide a cover letter with your experience and your
desired salary in English.

description:
|

Acavva OOD is an authorized partner of HedgeServ Corp. in Bulgaria. Acavva OOD
is hiring under labor contract Senior Java and Web Developers to expand their
distributed team in Sofia.

• **HedgeServ Corp.** \- Company Abstract

We are U.S. based hedge fund administration company with offices in New York,
Chicago, Boston, Dublin, London, Sydney, Luxembourg, Grand Cayman and Sofia.

• **Job Description**

You will be a member of a **highly-skilled**,** motivated** and **fun**
distributed **agile team**, with business analysts in Dublin, software
development and QA in New York and Sofia.

⦿ Expect **excellent salary** package: **3000** \- **6000** (Leva Net)

⦿ Working environment where **individuality**, **creativity**,
**craftsmanship** and **culture matter**!

⦿ We focus on **Agile practices** **and values**

⦿ **eXtreme Programming** in particular.

⦿ We are NOT an outsourcing shop, we develop our own products.

• **Knowledge and desired experience **(attitude, personality and intelligence
can substitute for some):

⦿ **Java** \- 5 years, with a focus on middle layer or back end.

⦿ **Spring**.

⦿ **Hibernate**, Experience with **SQL**.

⦿ **JavaScript**, experience with some of the popular **JS Frameworks** a
plus.

⦿ You should be able to manipulate **HTML5** and **CSS3** to your will.

⦿ **Git**, **Gradle**, Eclipse, IntelliJ IDEA, Ant, Subversion.

⦿ Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. **Team player!**

⦿ **Excellent level of English** (oral and written) is a must.

⦿ Willingness to **learn new technologies** is essential.  
  
⦿ Experience with **Agile Development** a plus.  

⦿ Experience with UI testing frameworks, such as Selenium, Sahi a plus.

⦿ Pro-active, enthusiastic and dedicated.

• **Practices we use **(we expect to evolve and add to them as we constantly
learn and grow):

⦿ **TDD** (Test-Driven Development) techniques.

⦿ **CI / CD** using Team City, Jenkins.

⦿ **Automated Unit and Acceptance Tests**.

⦿ **Daily Stand-up Meetings**: 5 - 5:30pm.

⦿ **Pair programming** (most of the time).

⦿ **Short iteration** with **frequent production releases**.

• **You will**:

⦿ Work in a small team, but have the support of a large global organization.

⦿ Have stability that a startup cannot provide, but enjoy startup-like
environment.

⦿ Learn that there is more to being a successful developer than just being
able to win a late night hackathon.

⦿ Learn not just how to write elegant code, but how to deliver that code, and
how to get it into production.

⦿ Work in a culture that rewards results.

⦿ Learn how to balance development speed against operational stability.

⦿ Be free to make many of your own decisions.

⦿ Should believe that web development is a craft that demands you to practice
and learn from others.

⦿ **Become a better craftsman!**

description:
|

Transmetrics is looking for a **Software Engineer**.

**WHO WE ARE:**

Transmetrics is one of the most promising Bulgarian startups, which brings Big
Data and predictive analytics to cargo transport industry in order to improve
capacity utilization.

At Transmetrics we are dedicated to revolutionizing the cargo transport
industry by making it more efficient and environmentally friendly. The 2
trillion EUR global cargo transport industry spends over half of its resources
to transport air. We offer a Big Data predictive analytics solution that
allows cargo transport companies to accurately predict future shipping
volumes, helping them to eliminate empty space in advance and optimize their
networks accordingly. This enables transport companies to improve their
capacity utilization, achieve significant savings and reduce their
environmental impact.

Transmetrics has successfully completed 3 pilot projects with logistics
companies, including the #1 transport company in the world. In 2015,
Transmetrics signed the contract with its first official customer - a DPD-
network partner and since then the team has been working with several world-
known clients.

Transmetrics has grown to 18 highly skilled employees working across Europe.
Our Board of Directors and Advisory Board consists of the current and former
professionals from logistics companies, including DHL, TNT Aviation,
a.hartrodt, Hellmann Worldwide Logistics, who are helping us every step of the
way. Up until now, Transmetrics has raised over EUR 1 million from LAUNCHub
and several business angels.

For our solution, Transmetrics has been internationally recognized with
various awards, including Forbes Business Awards, Startup of the Year by BAIT,
Berlin Startup Activation by EIT ICT Labs (winner), Pioneers Festival (Top-8
out of 850 startups).

**OUR EXPECTATIONS FOR CANDIDATES:**

  * Willingness to work in a startup
  * 2+ years of experience in software development
  * Knowledge of web technologies, Java, PHP, Python, SQL
  * Knowledge of HTML5, CSS, Javascript
  * Experience with AJAX, jQuery and asynchronous programming patterns

  * Good command of written and spoken English
  * Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field and/or demonstrated capability through previous experience

__**JOB DESCRIPTION:**  
  
__

You will join our engineering team in the Sofia office and will work directly
with the CTO. Some of your job responsibilities will be:

  * Collaborating with the rest of the team on product architecture
  * Designing and developing Transmetrics web application part
  * Developing various web and downloadable reports
  * Contributing to product backend modules

**WHAT WE OFFER:**

  * Working in a dynamic and fast-moving startup environment
  * Competitive salary
  * Stock options for the highest performing employees
  * An interesting and meaningful problem to solve. You will work on our product and your work will make a fundamental difference on the performance of the whole company
  * Working in the innovative fields of Big Data and predictive analytics
  * Great international team working across Europe
  * Convenient office location in Sofia (Lozenets district, metro station nearby)
  * 25 days of paid annual vacation
  * Flexible working time
  * Option to work from home periodically

  

_To apply, please send us your CV in English._

_Please note that only short-listed candidates will be contacted for an
interview (usually within 1 week)._

_Your application will be treated with confidentiality._
title: Software Engineer

description:
|

BM Technical Support Services’ (TSS) mission is to become the largest and most
successful provider of technical support services in the world. The Client
Innovation Center in Sofia, Bulgaria is building a trans-disciplinary team of
network support specialists tasked with supporting our clients in any country
worldwide.  
  
The Associate Network Support Specialist - Tier 1 is a Customer Service
Engineer role that is a member of a technical team who’s responsible for
owning and resolving support requests raised by customers. The team includes
mostly engineers with dual language proficiency (English plus one additional
language). Additional language required: French.  
  
**Main Responsibilities: **

  * Initial point of contact for resolving customer questions and issues related to Cisco networking products. 
  * Support is delivered via the phone, chat or web service requests.
  * Collaborate with other team members on a daily basis in order to achieve a satisfactory resolution to customer issues
  * Provide answers for general usage and operation questions related to Cisco networking equipment
  * Provide problem determination / problem source identification for known and published problems
  * Work within a fast paced environment while achieving high levels of accuracy with the information provided by the customer
  * Demonstrate excellent English skills in both oral and written communications, plus proficiency in French.
  * Follow Support Center processes for effective management of all assigned support incidents
  * This position will require ongoing skills development activities and successful completion of all required training curriculum
  * Support Center operational hours: 8AM – 8PM EEST Monday – Friday (incl holidays)

**Required:**  
**Knowledge / Skill and Expertise**

  * At least 6 months of experience in related customer support
  * Experience in a technical support role is a plus
  * Basic understanding of IT networking ie wireless, routing, switching, firewalls
  * Experience with Microsoft Operating systems at advanced user level
  * Experience with Microsoft Office ( Word, Outlook) at advanced user level
  * Bachelor's Degree (or equivalent) in Engineering or similar technical field
  * Ability to communicate in English, both spoken and written at B2-C2 level, plus additional fluent required language: French
  * Basic understanding of networking - TCP/IP, routing, switching, firewalls

**Soft Competencies**

  * Excellent communication skills
  * Excellent organizational skills
  * Good analytical and problem solving skills
  * Ability to work within a team
  * Ability to produce good documentation
  * Focused & Results orientated

  
**Additional information **  
  
+CCNA or equivalent Cisco certification is a plus  
+Technical Support experience is a plus  
  
_IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an
equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive
consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender,
gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics,
disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with
all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status._
title: Associate Network Support Specialist – Tier 1 with French
Business Analyst/Product Owner

description:
|

**DESCRIPTION  
**  
We are an international software company focused on mobile security, privacy
and end-to-end encryption. Our flagship products are the Android-based Secure
Phone and Secure Pack, as well as Secure BlackBerry.  
  
**Secure Group**, formerly DELATEK, is an international provider of solutions for secure mobile communications. As the name implies, we enable our customers to exchange sensitive information safely, protecting their business and personal life.  
  
We have built a name for our secure and user-friendly Secure Phone and Secure
BlackBerry smartphones, as well as Secure Pack – our suite of mobile
communication apps. Our products employ the best end-to-end encryption
technologies available.  
  
**OUR MISSION**  
  
Our ultimate mission is to ensure our customers’ cyber-security and enable
them to communicate in full privacy without compromising neither protection,
nor user-friendliness.  
  
**OUR VISION**  
  
No great goal could ever be achieved without a great vision. To accomplish our
mission, we have committed to providing the best encrypted communication
products, services and solutions, and to educating people.  
  
**We're now hiring an iOS Developer at our main R&D center, located in Sofia, Bulgaria.**  
  
**REQUIREMENTS**

  * Relevant** education**
  * **2+ years** of experience with professional iOS development and shipping mobile apps
  * Good knowledge of **native iOS SDK APIs**
  * Experience with native iOS **unit tests framework** and **UI testing automation**
  * Knowledge of **multi-threading** and **memory management**
  * Strong **analytical skills**
  * **High-quality code** and knowledge of **best practices**
  * Working level of** English**

_**It would be a plus** if you have development experience with at least one
other environment (web, Android, etc.)._  

**BENEFITS**

  * Competitive** remuneration**
  * Excellent working** environment**
  * Spacious office with** entertainment** and** relaxation** areas
  * We'll invest in your education — company-paid** tech courses**
  * Extra** day off** for each year you work at the company
  * Company-sponsored **SportPass** cards for various sports activities
  * Private **health insurance**
  * Free** parking**
  * **Relocation** assistance
  * And more...

_If you think we might be a good match, send us your **CV in English** and, if
possible, great examples of your work._
title: iOS DEVELOPER

description:
|  About Taulia:  
  
Imagine a company with the vision of fundamentally changing the pace with
which money flows across big and small businesses both in the US and
abroad…The greater the pace, the more quickly economies can grow and the
faster new jobs can be created. Welcome to Taulia.  
  
Taulia is a company of technical and financial entrepreneurs who wish to bring
simpler and more effective ways to facilitate commerce between the world’s
biggest companies and the thousands of suppliers who support them.  
  
Taulia's solution takes only hours to install, generates millions of dollars
of benefit, and is increasingly winning both national and international
recognition as best in its class.  
  
Coca-Cola Bottling, Pfizer, Warner Bros., Home Depot are among a growing list
of companies who have joined the Taulia journey.  
  
Taulia is based in San Francisco, CA, with multiple offices across the US and
Europe. We've been steadily growing and are looking for the next A-Player to
join our ranks. Have what it takes? If so, read on.  
  
About the Job:  
As an Automation Engineer you aren’t content with the status quo. You have a
high sense of ownership and always look for ways to go faster, be better, and
perform stronger. We give you the freedom to find that next challenge and the
support needed to make it a reality. We challenge ourselves and each other to
improve how we deliver our Agile Team’s work to customers, but always in a way
that makes them and your peers better for working with you. We win together;
we lose together.  
  
Responsibilities:  
● Automate, troubleshoot and maintain Selenium integration tests.  
● Lead self-initiated projects and speak up when issues arise.  
● Make stuff better by breaking it.  
  
Requirements:  
● 2+ years as an Automation Engineer in a Web/SaaS environment.  
● A firm knowledge of Jenkins and Groovy/Java.  
● Experience in short release cycles; proficient in an agile/scrum operating
environment.  
● Excellent analytical and research capabilities as well as superb verbal and
written skills.  
● BS or MS in Computer Science or equivalent experience.  
  
Nice to Have:  
● Cassandra, MySQL, ActiveMQ or Grails experience.  
  
  
Taulia is a rapidly growing San Francisco based start-up with fantastic job
benefits, tier one investors and an entertaining yet fantastically competent
culture. Taulia is an equal opportunity employer seeking only the most driven
(and humorous) entrepreneurial minded individuals to join our journey.  
  
If you take your job seriously, but not yourself. If you enjoy the wild ride
of start-up life and being a part of a team that knows how to debate, work
with passion, and laugh. If you can make a positive impact on a company's core
culture then apply now.
title: Automation Engineer

company: Hewlett Packard Enterprise / Hewlett-Packard GDBC EOOD
description:
|  Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) creates new possibilities for technology
to have a meaningful impact on people, businesses, governments and society.
HPE invents, engineers, and delivers technology solutions that drive business
value, create social value, and improve the lives of our clients. Our service
excellence, with consistent globally delivered standardized services
guarantees clients peace of mind, while our ability to drive innovation
ensures clients a compelling strategy for the future. Now we are looking for
Network Delivery Lead to join our constantly growing team.  
  
The role:  
  
The Network Delivery Lead is an important role bringing together the
competencies of several IT Operations areas, business and people oriented.
S/he will be responsible for the network infrastructure of a particular
customer(s) and ensure all deliverables are met.  
  
Main Tasks:  
The Network Delivery Lead is an important role bringing together the
competencies of several IT Operations areas, business and people oriented.
S/he will be responsible for the network infrastructure of a particular
customer(s) and ensure all deliverables are met.  
  
Deliver Leads also:  
Should act as “trusted advisor” and must have deep technical competencies, to
collaborate and facilitate delivery, engineering and account teams on the
resolution, improvement and avoidance of issues  
Act as a single point-of-contact for ongoing and project related topics for
the network infrastructure  
Maintain standards of performance, implementing and gaining compliance with
operating policies, procedures, and best practices, and ensuring the client’s
expectations for quality, service and timeliness are met  
Establish and maintain key client, account and delivery relationships  
Maintains operational and technical documentation  
Ensure the delivery team is aware of any new services being introduced  
Work proactively to avoid services interruptions and identify and implement
improvements opportunities  
Applies appropriate knowledge and methods to resolve complex business issues  
Participate in service reporting, service performance and customer account
reviews  
  
Qualifications  
Bachelor degree in Telecommunication, Computer Science or equivalent  
At least 3 years of relevant network experience  
Ability to relate technical applications to business environment, processes
and organization  
Well-developed customer relationship skills; ability to understand customers’
needs and develop appropriate solutions  
Good coordination and communication skills  
Time management skills and ability to multi-task and prioritize assigned
tasks, problems and requests in a high pressure environment  
Fluency in conversational and technical English, written and spoken  
Team player  
  
Advantages:  
Understanding of IT Service Management (ITSM) and IT Infrastructure Libraries
(ITIL) processes  
Any network related professional certifications  
Wide-range of networking knowledge (routing, switching, load balancing,
network security, wireless)  
  
We offer a challenging role including:  
Very Flexible Working time range and schedule  
Continuous learning and training opportunities including certification  
Ability to work in an international and multi-cultural organization  
Excellent social benefit package including:  
4 days additional paid leave (total:24 days)  
Food vouchers  
Work-life balance program including sport activities, team buildings, wellness  
Medical and Life insurance  
HPE badge program including various discounts for products and services  
  
If you feel comfortable with the above mentioned requirements, please, send us
your CV in English. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.  
  
This is to inform you that Hewlett Packard Enterprise GDBC EOOD (HPE) is
registered as an administrator of personal data to the Commission for Data
Protection. Some of the information that you provide voluntarily is personal
information and falls under the special protection regime under the Law on
Personal Data Protection. The personal data provided by you will be processed
for the purposes of the selection process as well as for the realization of
the legitimate interests of the data controller in respect of any future
contract of employment. HPE takes the responsibility to handle, use and store
your personal data, ensuring its protection in secret from the third parties.
We inform you and you agree that HP may provide your personal data to
government, municipal institutions, banks, companies, corporate bodies and
individuals, where such obligation exists under a special legal provision,
where it is necessary for realization of your rights and legal interests as a
participant in the selection process, and when it is necessary to realize the
legitimate rights and interests of HPE. HPE can provide your personal
information to corporate bodies and individuals who are assigned to actions
and activities relating to the selection process and in respect of any future
contract of employment.

description:
|  Shooger is one of the fastest growing US mobile advertising companies. Its
innovative solution links Advertisers and Consumers by incorporating Web and
Smartphone apps and provides the most complete geospatial mobile marketing
package available anywhere.  
  
The US-based company has an office in Bulgaria and is seeking to hire a Senior
Web Developer there.  
  
Job Description:  
  
The successful candidate will be responsible for the planning, development,
delivery and support of our applications. As a part of а team of outstanding
professionals you will be expected to deliver high quality solutions in a
fast-paced environment focused on the customer needs. Affinity for the latest
technologies, excellent communication and problem solving skills, self-
motivation, and ability for multi-tasking are the key aspects of this
position.  
  
Ability to estimate, structure, and organize one’s work in conjunction with
overall project architecture is key. Depending on the candidate’s progress on
their own work, a need to oversee a junior developer will eventually arise.  
  
Skills & Experience  
  
Required:  
• A minimum of 5 years of proven experience in software development.  
• Excellent understanding of C#, and .Net framework 3.5+.  
• Excellent understanding of ASP.NET, MVC, HTML5, Javascript, and jQuery.  
• Excellent knowledge of object oriented concepts.  
• Experience with LINQ or Entity framework.  
• Experience with Relational Databases and MS SQL Server  
• Experience with version control systems (SVN, GIT, or TFS).  
• Capacity to organize your work – self-driven.  
• Excellent communication skills.  
• Good working English.  
  
Appreciated:  
• Oversight of at least one junior developer.  
• Experience in a production environment with Distributed Source Control.  
• Experience in a production environment with Continuous Integration &
Deployment.  
  
  
About the company:  
  
We are creating one of the most robust, user-savvy networks of mobile users in
the world. Shooger users are socially-connected and instantly-enabled through
our network by posting reviews of businesses, deals, and being able to receive
time-sensitive offers & user-generated notifications at businesses that
are located immediately around them.  
  
Shooger changes the way that:  
• Consumers shop by providing rich user-generated feedback, privileged
relationships with their favorite businesses, and improving the relevance of
the products & services that they see.  
• Merchants handle advertising and their social/mobile presence by offering
them a one-stop-shop web & mobile marketing platform to communicate with
their customers and acquire new ones.  
  
Shooger offers:  
• Competitive salary.  
• Very positive team-oriented work environment.  
• Individual career path.  
• Highly tolerant work-life balance.  
  
All job applications will be treated with strict confidentiality.  
  
Please read this ad carefully. Your application is not going to be considered
if your resume does not match the above requirements. If you are interested,
please submit your resume.
title: Senior Web Developer

description:
|  БГСервиз е компания, фокусирана върху предоставянето на IT решения за
малкия и средния бизнес. Сред основните  
ни услуги са предоставяне на компютърна поддръжка, управление на ИТ проекти и
внедряване на различни  
софтуерни решения. Наред с работата ни с решенията на Microsoft ние твърдо
вярваме в ползите на отворения код. Поддържаме голямо количество сървъри под
Linux, а информационната система която разработваме е базирана на технологии с
отворен код.  
  
Търсим нов колега за нашия оперативен отдел, който да отговаря за разработка и
поддръжка на сървърни решения с отворен код.  
  
  
Основната отговорност на длъжността е да изгражда, поддържа и следи за
коректната работа на сървърни  
инфраструктури базирани на отворен код продукти. Задачите на позицията
включват:  
  
Инсталация и поддръжка на сървърни системи с отворен код;  
Работа със системата за проследяване и мониторинг на работещите системи;  
Установяване и отстраняване на проблемите отдалечено или на място при клиента;  
Диагностициране и отстраняване на проблеми, свързани с работата на софтуерни
продукти, мрежа или хардуерни  
проблеми;  
Решаване на ескалирани от второ ниво технически проблеми ;  
Отразяване на извършената работа в информационната система на фирмата;  
  
  
Изисквания на позицията :  
Познания и опит при работа с Ubuntu базирани системи  
Познания и опит при работа в следните области :  
а) Samba, OpenLDAP, rsync, rsnapshot  
b) Apache, php, mysql - инсталация, конфигурация, бекъпи  
c) Дискови масиви, както софтуерни така и хардуерни  
d) Мрежови конфигурации, рутери  
e) Postix, Zimbra(бонус), dovecot, cyrus  
f) Опит с виртуализация, KVM, Xen  
g) Ubuntu Server & Ubuntu desktop  
h) MikroTik настройка и конфигурация  
i) OpenVPN  
Предишен стаж и работа с Asterisk и/или FreePBX е предимство.  
  
Добри комуникативни умения  
Желание за работа в екип  
Много добро владеене на английски език  
Опит на подобна позиция минимум 2 години  
Шофьорска книжка  
  
Предложението:  
Дългосрочна позиция на пълен работен ден  
Обучение по време на работа  
Работа в коректна компания с млад и перспективен екип  
  
Проявявате интерес и отговаряте на нашите изисквания? Кандидатствайте по

description:
|  TAD Group has an exciting opportunity for a Cyber Security Penetration
Tester to join our team.  
  
Simulating a cyber attack under controlled conditions is the best way to know
how potential intruders will actually approach networks. TAD Group is a
company which delivers network, application, wireless, and social engineering
engagements to evaluate the cyber security level of the key systems and
infrastructure of our clients.  
  
Responsibilities:  
• Perform formal penetration tests on web-based applications, networks and
computer systems  
• Conduct physical security assessments of servers, systems and network
devices  
• Design and create new penetration tools and tests  
• Probe for vulnerabilities in web applications, fat/thin client applications
and standard applications  
• Pinpoint methods that cyber attackers could use to exploit weaknesses and
logic flaws  
• Employ social engineering to uncover security holes (e.g. poor user security
practices or password policies)  
• Incorporate business considerations (e.g. loss of earnings due to downtime,
cost of engagement, etc.) into cyber security strategies  
• Research, document and discuss cyber security findings with management and
IT teams  
• Review and define requirements for cyber security solutions  
• Work on improvements for cyber security services, including the continuous
enhancement of existing methodology material and supporting assets  
• Provide feedback and verification as an organization fixes security issues  
  
Requirements:  
• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering,
Telecommunications, or similar field required.  
• At least 1 year of cyber security-related experience with practice in
penetration testing and vulnerability assessments.  
• Windows, UNIX and Linux operating systems  
• Experience with penetration testing of popular Content Management Systems
(Wordpress, Joomla, etc.)  
• C, C++, C#, Java, PHP  
• Network servers and networking tools (e.g. Nessus, nmap, Burp, etc.)  
• Computer hardware and software systems  
• Web-based applications  
• Cyber security tools and products (Fortify, AppScan, etc.)  
• Vulnerability analysis and reverse engineering  
• Metasploit framework  
• Cryptography principles  
• Strong reporting and written documentation experience  
  
We offer:  
• A competitive remuneration package  
• A new team working in a visionary company with big potential  
• Flexible working hours (we focus on results)  
• Training and certification  
  
  
We would love to hear about your skills and your experience, as well as any
questions you might have.  
Only short-listed candidates will be contacted. All applications will be
treated in strictest confidentiality.

description:
|  Documaster is a tech startup established in 2014 after a pilot project for
Norway’s third largest municipality. In the last two and a half years, our
team grew from three to fifteen people, we got a whole bunch of new investors
on board, and have been enjoying significant attention in our circles and by
media lately.  
  
We are a product company and work in the area of enterprise information
archiving, records management, and electronic government. Our software is
designed to help both public and private sector organizations. After reaching
fifty clients recently, we now aim to double that number by the end of the
year.  
  
The Documaster product development team is mostly concentrated in Sofia,
Bulgaria, and we are currently expanding it with five more people.  
  
**As a Documaster developer**, you will learn the intricacies of electronic records management in Scandinavia and see how challenging it is to create great software that is also standards-compliant. Your key goal will be to make it easy for private and public sector organizations to archive their most valuable documents and to allow employees or the general public to easily find and retrieve these documents today as well as thirty years from today. You will be constantly looking for ways to breathe new life into old data.  
  
**As a Java developer**, you will be developing new functionality in our records management system and document processing server both of which run on Linux and are based on open-source technology.  
  
You will do data modeling while working with PostgreSQL and MongoDB, and will
learn to overcome the limitations of object-relational mapping frameworks when
using Hibernate. Having to think about multiple threads executing the same
code at the same time will become a part of your daily routine. This will be
extremely valuable when you start improving the code that indexes documents
and metadata in Solr, the code that OCRs documents with Tesseract and converts
them to PDF/A, or the code that exports terabytes of data from the system and
needs to do it efficiently.  
  
As a part of our team, you will also be designing and documenting web
services, always considering their future use and backwards compatibility when
a change is required. You will be writing unit and integration tests and
configuring Bamboo build jobs to create Maven artifacts and push them to an
artifact repository when a build runs successfully.  
  
You will be using Git to squash and reword commits, merge and rebase branches,
and handle releases, bugfixes and hotfixes. You will do code reviews and have
your code reviewed.  
  
Once you feel comfortable with the above, you will have the opportunity to
occasionally tear off pieces of the system to refactor them. The goal will be
to make the system better and keep the codebase small and easy to maintain.  
  
**We love** seeing motivated and satisfied people in the office every day. If you want to work in a team that constantly challenges you, and the job described here genuinely sparks your interest, you should get in touch with us right away. We will surely offer you a competitive salary if you are the right match for our team. On top of that, we have a bonus system and offer additional health insurance. There are more goodies but we would like to keep them as pleasant surprises.  
  
**Send us your CV** in English and tell us in five sentences why you find this job interesting, and how you will help us be a stronger team.
title: Senior Java developer

description:
|

Documaster is a tech startup established in 2014 after a pilot project for
Norway’s third largest municipality. In the last two and a half years, our
team grew from three to fifteen people, we got a whole bunch of new investors
on board, and have been enjoying significant attention in our circles and by
media lately.  
  
We are a product company and work in the area of enterprise information
archiving, records management, and electronic government. Our software is
designed to help both public and private sector organizations. After reaching
fifty clients recently, we now aim to double that number by the end of the
year.  
  
The Documaster product development team is mostly concentrated in Sofia,
Bulgaria, and we are currently expanding it with five more people.  
  
**As a Documaster developer**, you will learn the intricacies of electronic records management in Scandinavia and see how challenging it is to create sexy software that also complies with standards. Together with our designer, you will always be looking for ways to make the process of archiving and retrieving valuable documents as effortless and intuitive as possible.

**As a PHP/JavaScript developer**, you will be working on our Symfony-based web interface which is the main point of entry to our records management system and document processing server, and what most end users see. You will be using web services to communicate with the backend components, but will nevertheless have to delve deeply into many of the underlying specifics including the data model, access control model, and development cycle.

You will be using a variation of MVC when writing PHP code for the user
interface. To make the interface more appealing, you will be writing quite a
lot of JavaScript while making sure that a minimum set of functionality is
supported when JavaScript is disabled. You will have many close encounters
with the Bootstrap framework and write Twig templates to allow our designer to
help you with the HTML and CSS.

Your job will require a good understanding of the complete system, so you will
be working with Linux quite extensively: writing Bash scripts, configuring
Cron jobs, meddling with init scripts, and configuring Apache, among other
Linux-related tasks. You will be using Git to squash and reword commits, merge
and rebase branches, and handle releases, bugfixes, and hotfixes. You will
also do code reviews and have your code reviewed.

When the time allows it, you will be refactoring code to try to keep the
codebase small and easy to maintain. Occasionally you will also be talking to
customers to understand their needs better. This will make it easier for you
to create proof-of-concept prototypes, which is also an essential part of the
job.  
  
**We love** seeing motivated and satisfied people in the office every day. If you want to work in a team that constantly challenges you, and the job described here genuinely sparks your interest, you should get in touch with us right away. We will surely offer you a competitive salary if you are the right match for our team. On top of that, we have a bonus system and offer additional health insurance. There are more goodies but we would like to keep them as pleasant surprises.  
  
**Send us your CV** in English and tell us in five sentences why you find this job interesting, and how you will help us be a stronger team.

description:
|  _**The Product Owner is responsible for managing the whole process of
creating a product, starting from inception and managing through the whole
product lifetime.**_  
  
You will be responsible for executing the building and testing of products as
well as producing specifications for developers. You will operate as an agile
product owner and will need to have a deep understanding of both what we are
building and why.  
  
You’ll be part of our product department, sitting alongside the other product
owners and working closely with the development and design teams to deliver
your products. You will report to a UK-based product manager who will be
responsible for the overall vision of the product.  
  
Nothing will be more important than an in-depth knowledge of our products and
the direction of the whole business.  
  
  
  
_**This is a Global role.**_  
  
You’ll have to work collaboratively across the whole of Reward Gateway.
Through working with the whole company you will get first hand experience of
our service standards and commitments to our clients. Using this first hand
experience will enable you to deliver products that tie together the disparate
elements of the business. You will be required to travel to the UK.  
  
  
  
_**The sort of people we're looking for, the ones who will excel in this role
are:**_  
  

  * Bright, positive and self motivated;
  * Quick to learn, excited to learn and willing to invest personal time and energy in learning;
  * Technical with a good understanding of how websites work and ideally with a decent knowledge of programming;
  * Developers looking for a more commercial role will definitely be considered;

  
  
_**This is what we do**_  
  
We create products for HR. Products that are innovative, easy to use and
deliver high engagement for every one of our clients. High engagement is what
makes our clients happy and that client number is growing fast. We currently
work with over 1200 companies including American Express, Groupon, Yahoo!,
IBM, and McDonald’s. Each client uses our core product SmartHub, an employee
engagement platform which allows them to build an employee experience unique
to their organisation.  
  
We strictly “solve for HR,” if you ever join us you’ll hear us say that a lot.
HR are our customer, we understand their world and their world only, we care
passionately about what they achieve in their role, and we’re here to help
them.  
  
  
  
_**This is why the world needs us**_  
  
Ever had the Sunday night feeling of dread knowing you’ve got to get up for
work the next day?  
  
We see a world where people expect more from work. A world where everyone can
expect to be challenged, be inspired and feel valued. And we believe in that
world, amazing things will happen. Organisations will grow stronger, and
people will be happier.  
  
We want to make the world a happier place to work.  
  
  
  
**_This is why some people love working here_**  
  
We work hard, and we play hard. We are passionate about what we do, and it
shows. You’re part of a family here. If you walked into our office, you
wouldn’t know who started last week, who has been here 10 years or who is in
which department, we all sit and work together. Everyone is willing to help,
no matter what your question is. It’s rare to find a company where everyone is
so genuinely kind and helpful. You’ll make lifelong friends here.  
  
Two of our values are “Be Human” and “Love Your Job.” No one is ever just a
number at RG; we celebrate our differences and learn from each other. We
produce better results when we work together and embrace each other’s
strengths and are honest about our weaknesses.  
  
  
  
_**This is why some people hate working here**_  
  
We are a fast-growing company in a fast-growing market, and we're hugely
ambitious. If you don’t like rapid change and lack of a highly-structured
schedule, we might not be for you. Our product constantly adapts, so our
employees need to as well. You may spend countless hours on projects only to
reprioritise in minutes and scrap the whole thing. You need to be comfortable
with being uncomfortable because we don’t believe failure is only an option,
but essential to the process of innovation.  
  
You won’t always be able to talk to your manager or project team face to face
as they may be off in another time zone at one of our other offices across the
globe. If your team is in Australia, and you forget to turn off the alerts on
your phone, you may be woken up in the wee hours of the morning because
they’re still working. This is not a 9-5 job, and a 24/7 global business isn’t
for everyone! We understand that Reward Gateway’s culture is not one size fits
all, and we don’t take it personally!  
  
  
  
**_This is how we take care of you_**  
  

  * 35 days holiday including bank holidays with the option to buy or sell an additional 5;
  * Employee Share Ownership;
  * Parental Leave - 12 months fully paid parental leave for the first full year of the child's birth or adoption, regardless of your gender. Even if you're not the primary caregiver you can get 4 weeks full pay within the first year;
  * Life Insurance;
  * Wellbeing Choice - Money to spend on wellbeing activity of your choice which includes mental, physical and financial;
  * The Reward Gateway employee lottery, a monthly draw with thirteen prizes tax paid!
  * Bonus if you suggest someone who we hire;
  * Free breakfast items and soft drinks;
  * Free sight tests;
  * Bonus if you get married or have a civil partnership;
  * Bonus if you have or adopt a child;
  * Flexible Working;
  * Bring your dog to work;

description:
|

Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) creates new possibilities for technology to
have a meaningful impact on people, businesses, governments and society. HPE
invents, engineers, and delivers technology solutions that drive business
value, create social value, and improve the lives of our clients. The largest
line of business - Enterprise Services produces better business outcomes for
our clients through our comprehensive Infrastructure Technology Outsourcing
Services. Our service excellence, with consistent globally delivered
standardized services guarantees clients peace of mind, while our ability to
drive innovation ensures clients a compelling strategy for the future.

Hewlett Packard Enterprise in Bulgaria has established an IT Operations
Centre, which developed into one of the top Delivery Centers for
Infrastructure Management Services operating World Wide. The impeccable
service quality, along with traditional hard working, won us a leading
industry position for less than three years of operation.  
  
**We have a number of opportunities for System / Network / Storage / NAS / Backup and Recovery Administrators** with minimum 1 year of relevant experience. We provide training up to Data Storage and Storage Area Network Support Engineer.   
  
  
**The role:**   
  
The **Data Storage Engineer** focuses on the continuous operation of our
customers' Storage Area Network and Data Storage environment. His/her main
responsibility is to ensure data accessibility, consistency and
recoverability. The Data Storage Engineer works in an environment where fast
educated decisions may save the day, however quality and perfection are our
major objective.  
  
• Work on break/fix Data Storage and Storage Area Network incidents and
customer service calls;  
• Troubleshoot complex issues and provide solutions;  
• Data Storage and Storage Area Network performance monitoring and consulting;  
• Design, innovate, deploy and follow solutions/procedures to improve working
process;  
• Implementing changes in the Storage Area Network environment;  
• Every-day learn to stay on top of the Data Storage and Storage Area Network
technology (access to the HP training systems available).  
  
  
**Preferred skills and qualifications (will be considered as advantage):**   
  
• Master Engineer in Computer Science with at least 1 year of experience in IT
area;  
• Understanding of project management methodologies and processes;  
• Practical experience in one or more of the following: Cisco, Brocade, McData
switches;  
• Practical experience in one or more of HP, EMC, IBM, NetApp or equivalent
enterprise class data storage arrays;  
• Practical experience in managing large Storage Area Network Fabrics and NAS
/ CIFS / NFS;  
• General HP OpenView experience (Monitoring, Reporting);  
• Good skills in planning and concepts for Data Storage environments;  
• Knowledge of ITSM, ITIL or equivalent Service Management qualifications;  
• SNIA / HP-ASE / BCP / CISCO CCNP/A certification or similar qualifications;  
• Any qualifications exceeding the requirements will be considered as
advantage.  
  
  
**We offer:**   
  
• Membership in highly qualified young, enthusiastic team;  
• Exposure to cutting edge technologies and releases and biggest world-wide
environments having the flexibility of remote login;  
• Training, continuous learning and career development in Data Storage Devices
and Storage Area Networking support;  
• Ability for certifications of HP Storage works, XP, EVA, EMC Symmetrix, EMC
CLARiiON, EMC Celerra, NetApp Data Ontap, Brocade etc;  
• Competitive remuneration package;  
• Medical insurance;  
• 4 days additional paid leave (total:24 days);  
• Food vouchers;  
• Life insurance;  
• Wellness program;  
• HPЕ badge program including various discounts for products and services;  
• Work-life balance program including free legal, financial and psychological
consultations.  
  

Thanks for taking the time to review our job, if you think it is a match to
your experience and interests please apply today— we are eager to learn more
about you! If you know a friend who may be a fit for the job please refer
them.  
  

Please note:

This is to inform you that Hewlett Packard GDBC EOOD (HP) is registered as an
administrator of personal data to the Commission for Data Protection. Some of
the information that you provide voluntarily is personal information and falls
under the special protection regime under the Law on Personal Data Protection.
The personal data provided by you will be processed for the purposes of the
selection process as well as for the realization of the legitimate interests
of the data controller in respect of any future contract of employment. HP
takes the responsibility to handle, use and store your personal data, ensuring
its protection in secret from the third parties. We inform you and you agree
that HP may provide your personal data to government, municipal institutions,
banks, companies, corporate bodies and individuals, where such obligation
exists under a special legal provision, where it is necessary for realization
of your rights and legal interests as a participant in the selection process,
and when it is necessary to realize the legitimate rights and interests of HP.
HP can provide your personal information to corporate bodies and individuals
who are assigned to actions and activities relating to the selection process
and in respect of any future contract of employment.

description:
|  Working in Coherent Labs is like being James Bond - we do things that seem
impossible!  
We dream big and set ambitious goals, which we are determined to achieve.  
  
Hundreds of studios around the world are already using our powerful technology
to create stunning user interfaces. We are a dynamic and passionate team based
in Sofia and San Francisco and we will change the way each and every studio
creates game UI.  
  
So what’s the deal? You will have a chance to work on the Coherent WYSIWYG
Еditor, which is the first editor specifically designed for game UI as well as
on our next generation of AAA game UI kits for various genres of games. We
create our proprietary technologies including the Hummingbird HTML5 renderer
and the Renoir graphics library. It is quite a challenging task, which very
few companies are willing to take on, including Microsoft, Google, Mozilla,
and Apple.  
  
  
What you will be doing:  
  
• Write stunning world-class code using modern JS workflow (TypeScript and
ES6)  
• Work on the first HTML Editor ever created, specially designed for Game UI  
• Design and develop the fastest MV*, data-binding and animation libraries for
JavaScript  
• Create highly customizable UI components for all kinds of game genres and
platforms  
• Disrupt the gaming industry with your bare hands  
  
Our type of person has:  
  
• 2+ years of experience in web applications development  
• Expert knowledge of HTML5/CSS and responsive design principles  
• Expert knowledge of design patterns, best coding practices and performance
optimizations  
• Expert knowledge of TypeScript and ES6  
• Experience with modern JavaScript MVC and MVVM frameworks (such as React,
Backbone, Angular, or Ember) and JavaScript task runners  
• Experience with large scale JavaScript applications  
  
Will be considered a plus:  
  
• Fascination for games and game development  
• Experience with animation libraries such as GSAP, Tween.js  
• Experience in building new libraries or visual UI editors  
  
We can offer you:  
  
• The unique opportunity to bring the latest innovations of the web
technologies into the gaming world  
• Internal training program designed to constantly expand your skillset  
• Work with your favourite game development and high-tech companies! Even NASA
works with us!  
• Experience cutting edge technologies (Oculus Rift, Steam VR, Leap Motion)  
• Work in a team where everyone’s opinion matters and you can literally make a
change  
• Take part in major game events and conferences (GDC, Gamescom, E3, etc.)  
• Highly competitive salary and benefits  
• Excellent working environment and an office with a central location (NDK)  
  
If you believe you are just the right person for us, apply now and join us at
Coherent Labs!
title: Senior JavaScript/TypeScript Developer

description:
|  Are you passionate about games and game development? Do you want to take
part in the creation of some awesome new titles?  
  
If the answers to the questions above are "yes", then we have the right
position for you! We are looking for a fun, geeky person to join our team on
the position of а Senior C++ Software Engineer.  
  
Hundreds of studios around the world are already using our powerful technology
to create stunning user interfaces. We are a dynamic and passionate team based
in Sofia and San Francisco and we will change the way each and every studio
creates game UI. We are proud to say that we are one of the few companies
which is a licensed PlayStation 4 and Xbox One developer. Just a small part of
the games, created with our products are Guild Wars 2, Planetary Annihilation,
Dirty Bomb, The Culling and many more.  
If you are excited about complex software problems, join us. We are looking
for members to become part of the Core development team and make an impact on
the game development industry! You will have a chance to work on graphics APIs
for any platform imaginable, task systems, CSS parsers, multi-threaded trees,
and many more.  
  
Daily responsibilities in a nutshell:  
  
• Design and implement new features for our core products  
• Optimize and debug complex software systems  
• Participate in the architecture decisions  
• Implement platform-specific optimizations for PC/PlayStation 4/Xbox
One/mobile  
• Implement VR-related features  
• Peer-review code  
• Support AAA game companies and game engine providers working with our
products  
  
The skills we are looking for:  
  
• At least 4 years of experience working on high-performance applications,
games or real-time systems  
• Deep knowledge of C/C++, compiler internal workings, code generation and
hardware architectures  
• Knowledge of advanced data structures, algorithms and memory management  
• Multithreading experience  
• Experience with code and data optimization techniques  
• Strong grasp of mathematical concepts, linear algebra and analytical
geometry  
• Multi-platform development know-how  
• Experience with at least one graphics API - DirectX 11+, OpenGL, Metal,
Vulkan  
• Ability to work with different debugging and profiling tools - Microsoft
PIX, Renderdoc, Intel VTune etc.  
• Basic knowledge about how games and game engines work  
  
• C#, Python, JavaScript knowledge is considered a plus  
  
We can offer you:  
  
• An opportunity to work along with your favourite game development companies
- even NASA works with us!  
• Work with modern languages and cutting edge technologies (Oculus Rift,
SteamVR, Leap Motion)  
• A chance to develop/code for all major game engines - Unreal Engine 4,
Unity3D, Amazon Lumberyard, CryEngine 3/V  
• Develop for PlayStation 4 and Xbox One  
• Work in a team where your ideas and opinion matter and a great startup
atmosphere  
• Try out new games before anyone else has  
• Take part in major game events and conferences (GDC, Gamescom, E3, etc.)  
• Competitive salary and awesome benefits  
• Welcoming work environment and an office with a central location (NDK)  
  
If you want to work with the best and the brightest, apply now at Coherent
Labs!
